Class StartButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • src.StartButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    class StartButton
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    What is to happen when the "start" button is pressed

    • Field Summary

      The drawer thread
      private javax.swing.JTextField timeField

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Once the linked button is pressed, the integer in the JField timeField is read and sent to the worker.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartButton

        public StartButton(javax.swing.JTextField t,
                   Worker cp,
                   Drawer p)
        Basic constructor
        Parameters:
        t - the textfield that is to be read once the button is pressed
        cp - the worker thread that is to be updated with a new time for the algorithm
        p - the drawer that is to be notified once the bunnon is pressed

    • Method Detail

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Once the linked button is pressed, the integer in the JField timeField is read and sent to the worker. Then, the drawer is notified.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseClicked in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
